 Denikin Pyotr Wrangel Nikolai Yudenich |strength1 = 3,000,000 |strength2 = 2,400,000 White Russians, 255,000 in Allied

The 'Russian Civil War' (7 November (25 October) 1917 â October 1922) was a multi-party war in the former Russian Empire fought between
the Bolshevik Red Army and the White Army, the loosely allied anti-Bolshevik
forces. Many foreign armies warred against the Red Army, notably the Allied
Forces and the pro-German armies. [http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/513737/Russian-
Civil-War Russian Civil War] Encyclopaedia Britannica Online 2012 The Red
Army defeated the White Armed Forces of South Russia in Ukraine and the army led
by Aleksandr Kolchak in Siberia in 1919. The remains of the White forces
commanded by Pyotr Nikolayevich Wrangel were beaten in the Crimea and were
evacuated in the autumn of 1920. Many pro-independence movements emerged after
the break-up of the Russian Empire and fought in the war. A
number of them â Finland, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, and Poland â were
established as sovereign states. The rest of the former Russian Empire was
consolidated into the Soviet Union shortly afterwards. For events on the
territory of modern Ukraine view also UkrainianâSoviet War.
categories: Civil wars involving the states and peoples of Europe
